chunks.content: In July 2002, Beyoncé continued her acting career playing Foxxy Cleopatra alongside Mike Myers in the comedy film, Austin Powers in Goldmember, which spent its first weekend atop the US box office and grossed $73 million.

metadata.topic: Beyoncé's role in Austin Powers in Goldmember

chunks.content: Beyoncé released 'Work It Out' as the lead single from its soundtrack album which entered the top ten in the UK, Norway, and Belgium.
In 2003, Beyoncé starred opposite Cuba Gooding, Jr., in the musical comedy The Fighting Temptations as Lilly, a single mother whom Gooding's character falls in love with.

metadata.topic: Beyoncé's role in The Fighting Temptations

chunks.content: The film received mixed reviews from critics but grossed $30 million in the U.S. Beyoncé released 'Fighting Temptation' as the lead single from the film's soundtrack album, with Missy Elliott, MC Lyte, and Free which was also used to promote the film.

metadata.topic: Reception and soundtrack of The Fighting Temptations

chunks.content: Another of Beyoncé's contributions to the soundtrack, 'Summertime', fared better on the US charts.
